intro: Armeriastrum splendidum, commonly known as the silverleaf armeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Its compact growth habit and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping.
